THE undersigned having been appointed by
the Borough Council Committe to receive Pro-
posals for a Loan not exceeding $4,000 Dollars.
on the credit Of the Borough of Wilmington,
for the purpose of supplying the Borough with
water, at rate of interest not exceeding FIVE
per centum per annum, payable semi-annually,
and reinbursable at the end of 90 years from the
ith Of July, l627-Notice is therefore hereby
given, that such proposals will now be received
by the undersigned at any time after the present
date, fer taking said Loan.


JAMES BROBSON,


JAMES GARDNER,


JOSEPH GRUBB,


WIN. LARkIN,

Mr.. Sonthworth Rowland, of West
Brookfield, Mass. says Worcester paper,
has succeeded in remedying the evil occa-
stoned by the anputaton of limbs. The
substitutes are made with joints in the toes,
ancle. and knee. They are worn with ease,
and appear natural. They have been proved
hv many individuals, and in all cases have
completely answered the purpose for which
they are Intended.

A note tron1 our correspondent at Boston,
dated al Q p. M. on Saturday. mentions that
the U. S. frigate Java, Com. Crane, after
eating below since Tuesday for favorable
breeze, put to sea on that day. The pilot
left her at 2P. M. with fine breeze. Our
correspondent adds, that since she has been
in that port she has been almost entirely re-
built. and is now as fine ship as there Is in
the navy.

wood, the custom house officer at Hampton, to
whom Col. Gratot had in the first instance sent
information, and she has been sent up to Norfolk.

8uynirr fIountains.--T last Edinburg
Review contains an article on Volcanoes.
/ NJ Daubeny, in a work lately published on
this subject, furnishes some facts and rciiec-
tions: the result of his travels. observations
!, and studies. The substances thrown out by
; volcanoes are chiefly composed OF the Gle


mcnts of granite, gncss, and other primitive


rocks, which renders it most probable that
, they are brought from great depth. 1t Is
! remark able that the 1863 volcanoes mention
cd by Arago are all near the sea; and that
not single active one is to be found in the
interior of any country. Volcanic regions
and cxtinguished volcanoes are known at


distance from the sea; but generally in dis
tricts which appear to have emerged from
the water Earthquakes are most violent


in countries where there are not volcanoes:
az if they served to vent their force.

The Friends Of agriculture and Nlcnu-
factnres in the State Of Delaware, are re-
questcd to meet at the Town Hall, in Will
nngton, on WEDNESDAY, NEXT. the
27th day Of June, at O'Clock in the after
noon, in order to express their sentiments
OH the propriety Of taking such measures as
will promote their views for the support Of
these objects of national concern. AS a very
liberal expression has been lately called
forth at seveal meetings of our fellow citi-
zens in the neighboring States. upon the
general question Of the support Of Domestic
Industry, it is hoped general representa-
ton will be made of those important interests
of the country in which we are all united un-
der conviction that 'the Domestic Market
is the best of all markets for the rude pro-
ductions of the soil,
domestic Industry.

MYSTERIOUS Marriage.--A Lady dressed


in the most elegant style of fashion, walking
past the horse Guards early in the morning
lately addressed private soldier helonginl


10 the Fout- G yards, in the following man


ner:-


t Lady--Soldier, are you single MANI
: The soldier confused at the question put
!, him) replied he was.
Z Lady--Then. Soldier, will you have m


for wife'


Sodier--(stll more confuset)-l have II


objections, madam. ;.
Lady-then come with me. have q
cense and ring (taking them out OF nc he.
rcticue); and we will be married immeai
ately.


The lady then called hackney coacl
from the stand and proceeded to st. -----~


where they were married. Immediately OF
their return the lady stepped into the coacl
(frst handing the bridegroom 20 sovere'gnss
telling him that she would send for him II


the evening, and afterwards purchase HI
. discharge. She then ordered the coachnaI
to drive forward, and from that time to The
| present the soldier has never seen nor heart
from his bride, It is scarcely possible t
f conjecture what could have been the LADY,
motives. unless she wished, for some Par


tcuiQr hu1hosc, to show the certificate o


her marriage ia.

18th ult. says:-"It is understood that Boil
WAR will resume his station as President OF
the Republic, and has given up all his views
about the Bolivian Constitution

Virginia. The Richmond Wing says that
the cause of the Convention in Virginia is Of
.ir greater interest than the election OF Mr..
Adams, or Gen. Jackson. The people in
that state are deprived of the right of suf-
frage. and every friend OF liberty will wish
them success.

A meeting of upwards Of 500 journeymen
carpenters, was held at Philadelphia on
Wednesday. The object was to limit the
hours of work from six t'clo:k in the morn
ing 10 six in the evening. Resolutions to that
effect were unanimously passed.

A hearty, good looking man went into a
store on Thursday morning last, near second
and Market streets, Philadelphia, and while
bargaining for some articles with the shop
keeper. the only one there at the time. sud
denly became very sick and appeared to be
fainting. The shopkeeper very humanely
ran into the yard back of the house to get
some water for the sufferer; but when he re-
turned, and he did SO with great haste--5c-

paragraph. from the Canadian spectator, u
would appear that the disputes IN that prov
ince have assumed serious aspect


Unhleasing IntelHgence.-We are sorry
to observe it announced IN the onleiai 'a-

hat srditous meetings have been held that
ought to be dispersed by public foroe' 'od

hold. the bird was flown. and FIVE pieces Of

was raised was too late.

Ligiming.-The house of Mr.. 1il,on
in Newburyport. was struck by lightning
during tremendous thunder shower on
Saturday afterno9n-the electric fluid de-
scended by the chimney, tearing away many
bricks, and entering a room where the fam
ily were sitting, struck in succession, two
children and an elderly lady; one Of the
children was instantly killed. another burnt
in the face, and the lady's clothes were much
burnt.

"WwrHarmony, 50th April, 1927"


Mr.. Maclure is an enthusiast upon the
subject of education. He had made it his
study in Europe for many years, and from
the above NAV be inferred the result Of his
experiment upon Owenism. He has been a
munificent contributor in rare and valuable
books, and costly European, minerals, TO the
American Geological Socity.

day last the wind blew very strong i'll the
neighbourhood Of the Three Rivers. A raft
in going down, was wrecked at St. Jean de
Chailiens, and melancholy to relate, sir
teen of the hands perishcd--only two were

We observe that another instance of
death BY suffocation from burning charcoal,
has happened at the eastward. 1t occur
red on board of vessel at Bridgeport, Conn.
in the cabin Of which "A man entered after
a kettle Of burning charcoal had been plac-
ed therein.


A passenger in one of the day boats be-
tween Albany and New York, counted in
the course of the passage, two hundred and
seventy sloops on the North River.


The Mercer "Western Paper" says "the
Printer wants Grain, Pork, Talow, Candles,
Whiskey, Linen, Beeswax, Wool; and any
thing else that he can eat"


The Trustees of the Boston Monument
Association have voted unanimously to have
the Statue of Washington placed in the new
State House.


Passengers in the packet ship Canada, ar
rived at New York, on Monday last--Isaac



Bigge, ]. Fl. Hodges, Thomas Hetherington,
and John lnham.


The blue pendant of Captain Crane, as
commander of the United States Mcditer-
ranean squadron, was hoisted on Friday
week, on board the irigate Java, ~ guns, ly-
ing at Boston, under national salute. She
is expected to sail soon.


154 persons in the city of N. York have
applied for lots in the new town of Guelph,
in Upper Canada.


The Emperor of Russia has given two
thousand roubles, and the Empress dla-
mond ring, to the blind poet J. J. keslov, for
transating Byron's Bride OF Aydos into Rus
sian.


St. Giles Church, in London, has nov
an illuminated dial the clock, by its own
revolution, lights itself as soon as the sun
sets. and extinguishes itself when the sun
rises.

states that during heavy gust there on the

in that county. was levelled to
the ground. such was the violence of the
wind that some of the heavy timbcrs were
carried considerable distance.

full articles.headline: borough XAoan.
full articles.article:
THE undersigned having been appointed by
the Borough Council Committe to receive Pro-
posals for a Loan not exceeding $4,000 Dollars.
on the credit Of the Borough of Wilmington,
for the purpose of supplying the Borough with
water, at rate of interest not exceeding FIVE
per centum per annum, payable semi-annually,
and reinbursable at the end of 90 years from the
ith Of July, l627-Notice is therefore hereby
given, that such proposals will now be received
by the undersigned at any time after the present
date, fer taking said Loan.


JAMES BROBSON,


JAMES GARDNER,


JOSEPH GRUBB,


WIN. LARkIN,


Committee.
June 12th, 1897. S9-tf.

Death warrants have been issued BY the
Governor of Maryland, directing the execu-
ton of two negroe men, one in Somerset co.
for wilful murder. and the other in Prince
Georges county, for rape.


According to paragraphs in the Richmond
and Winchester papers, the Wheat Crops
in those sections Of Virginia promise to be a.
bundant.

gines in good order; five Hook and Ladder
Trucks; upwards of 1900 feet Of Hose; and

inst. says that the season tickets sold tor
the exhibition at the Atheneum Gallery,
amount to 1000, besides nearly 1000 single
admissions.

THE WILMINGToNTAN,

DELAWARE ADVERTISER.

Thursday, June 81, 1897.
full articles.article:
The Editors of the Saturday Evening
Post" having appointed the proprietor of
this paper their Agent for collecting sub
Wilmington and its vicinity. we would in
form those who are in arrears for either,
that their bills are at the office of the Will
minstonian. where they are requested to
call and receive them.

full articles.headline: Cure for Inte mperance.
full articles.article:
The Wilmington Society for Suppressing
Intemperance, has received few doses Of
the celebrated medicine Of DR. w. Cham
bers. of n. York, which may be had on ap-
plication to James Watson, Thos. Moor
klc, or VIM. A. Mendenhall, Confidential
Committee; who may at any time be found
at their respective places of business.

cret agent was seen by two individuals, one

full articles.headline: Mr.. Sonthworth Rowland. of We
full articles.article:
Mr.. Sonthworth Rowland, of West
Brookfield, Mass. says Worcester paper,
has succeeded in remedying the evil occa-
stoned by the anputaton of limbs. The
substitutes are made with joints in the toes,
ancle. and knee. They are worn with ease,
and appear natural. They have been proved
hv many individuals, and in all cases have
completely answered the purpose for which
they are Intended.

A note tron1 our correspondent at Boston,
dated al Q p. M. on Saturday. mentions that
the U. S. frigate Java, Com. Crane, after
eating below since Tuesday for favorable
breeze, put to sea on that day. The pilot
left her at 2P. M. with fine breeze. Our
correspondent adds, that since she has been
in that port she has been almost entirely re-
built. and is now as fine ship as there Is in
the navy.

I..ngy so; ia:o the boa,, ard as soon as she was
lowered to the water, he cast off the teacles,
seized oar, and sculled away for the shore, the
pirate calling after him and asking if he was go
ing to betray him? On landing, the mate relat-
ed the above particulars to several of the officers
the Fortress who were for some time doubt
full as to the probability of the story; but on his
mentioning that the name of the vessel on the
stern had been oblteratcd, Capt. Dana ordered
boat and rowed off to the vessel to ascertain if
such was the fact. Before he had reached the
vessel, however, he was hailed from her by the
pilot, and informed that the pirate captain h0d
cut his Mront. The three Spanards had little
before, by some fnesse, got possession of boat
from neighborng vessel, and made their es-
cape to the Elizabeth City shore, where due dill
gcnce has been used to effect their apprehen-
sion. Capt. Dana and his boats crew boarded
the vessel and kept possession of her until she
WAS delivered over to the custody Of Mr.. West
wood, the custom house officer at Hampton, to
whom Col. Gratot had in the first instance sent
information, and she has been sent up to Norfolk.
An inquest was held on the body Of the pirate
captain, (whose name was believed from his pa
pers to have been .4ieranGer 7ardy, which was
the next morning inferred on the beach.

8uynirr fIountains.--T last Edinburg
Review contains an article on Volcanoes.
/ NJ Daubeny, in a work lately published on
this subject, furnishes some facts and rciiec-
tions: the result of his travels. observations
!, and studies. The substances thrown out by
; volcanoes are chiefly composed OF the Gle


mcnts of granite, gncss, and other primitive


rocks, which renders it most probable that
, they are brought from great depth. 1t Is
! remark able that the 1863 volcanoes mention
cd by Arago are all near the sea; and that
not single active one is to be found in the
interior of any country. Volcanic regions
and cxtinguished volcanoes are known at


distance from the sea; but generally in dis
tricts which appear to have emerged from
the water Earthquakes are most violent


in countries where there are not volcanoes:
az if they served to vent their force.

full articles.headline: domestic Industry.
full articles.article:
The Friends Of agriculture and Nlcnu-
factnres in the State Of Delaware, are re-
questcd to meet at the Town Hall, in Will
nngton, on WEDNESDAY, NEXT. the
27th day Of June, at O'Clock in the after
noon, in order to express their sentiments
OH the propriety Of taking such measures as
will promote their views for the support Of
these objects of national concern. AS a very
liberal expression has been lately called
forth at seveal meetings of our fellow citi-
zens in the neighboring States. upon the
general question Of the support Of Domestic
Industry, it is hoped general representa-
ton will be made of those important interests
of the country in which we are all united un-
der conviction that 'the Domestic Market
is the best of all markets for the rude pro-
ductions of the soil,

tude, and the knowledge OF which IS still likely
to escape the best directed inquiries, as accord

Meanwhile the Fellana, whose ambition is equal
to their ferocity, availing themselves of Major
Laing's arrival at ronbuctoo, and of the species
Of fprotcction which he had received there, seized
upon that city, and imposing an annual tribute,
which the inhabitants, unable TO offer resistance,
are in future to pay, for having it is said, made
themselves atcompces in project ofinvason
meditatel by the infidels. These last accounts
have been communicated by a Tripolitan Schc-
TX, who has long resided at Tombuctoo. He de-
carcs that there exists very interesting history
Of that city, which carries back its foundation TO
the year $40 Of the IIegira, GA. d. 1l16,) and
the author Of which is Sili-Iiames BAHIA, a ma
tive Of .Arawaw, a small borough of the Rents
country, considerable colony of the Sultan"
The London Courier states that dispatches
from the British consul al Iripoli SAYS that there
was reason 10 believe that the above report of
| Major Laing's death was uniounlcd.

MYSTERIOUS Marriage.--A Lady dressed


in the most elegant style of fashion, walking
past the horse Guards early in the morning
lately addressed private soldier helonginl


10 the Fout- G yards, in the following man


ner:-


t Lady--Soldier, are you single MANI
: The soldier confused at the question put
!, him) replied he was.
Z Lady--Then. Soldier, will you have m


for wife'


Sodier--(stll more confuset)-l have II


objections, madam. ;.
Lady-then come with me. have q
cense and ring (taking them out OF nc he.
rcticue); and we will be married immeai
ately.

where they were married. Immediately OF

There IS lace school or manniactory es-
tablished at Newport. Rhode Island, winch
gives profitable employment IN TINS new
branch TO 500 young ladies', and the various
articles of their ingenious and tasty ncedIe
will bear comparison with any thing OF the
kind ever imported.

18th ult. says:-"It is understood that Boil
WAR will resume his station as President OF
the Republic, and has given up all his views
about the Bolivian Constitution

Virginia. The Richmond Wing says that
the cause of the Convention in Virginia is Of
.ir greater interest than the election OF Mr..
Adams, or Gen. Jackson. The people in
that state are deprived of the right of suf-
frage. and every friend OF liberty will wish
them success.

A meeting of upwards Of 500 journeymen
carpenters, was held at Philadelphia on
Wednesday. The object was to limit the
hours of work from six t'clo:k in the morn
ing 10 six in the evening. Resolutions to that
effect were unanimously passed.

A hearty, good looking man went into a
store on Thursday morning last, near second
and Market streets, Philadelphia, and while
bargaining for some articles with the shop
keeper. the only one there at the time. sud
denly became very sick and appeared to be
fainting. The shopkeeper very humanely
ran into the yard back of the house to get
some water for the sufferer; but when he re-
turned, and he did SO with great haste--5c-

Ligiming.-The house of Mr.. 1il,on
in Newburyport. was struck by lightning
during tremendous thunder shower on
Saturday afterno9n-the electric fluid de-
scended by the chimney, tearing away many
bricks, and entering a room where the fam
ily were sitting, struck in succession, two
children and an elderly lady; one Of the
children was instantly killed. another burnt
in the face, and the lady's clothes were much
burnt.

Mr.. Maclure is an enthusiast upon the
subject of education. He had made it his
study in Europe for many years, and from
the above NAV be inferred the result Of his
experiment upon Owenism. He has been a
munificent contributor in rare and valuable
books, and costly European, minerals, TO the
American Geological Socity.

Fresh Tsae--A Cincinnati paper notices
as an instance of remarkable expedition,
that parcel Of goods was lately received
in that place, by the regular wagons aud
steamboats, from Baltimore among which was
quantity of tea, only one hundred and twcn-
ty days from Chiaa.

a late Montreal paper says:--"On Mon
day last the wind blew very strong i'll the
neighbourhood Of the Three Rivers. A raft
in going down, was wrecked at St. Jean de
Chailiens, and melancholy to relate, sir
teen of the hands perishcd--only two were
saved.


We observe that another instance of
death BY suffocation from burning charcoal,
has happened at the eastward. 1t occur
red on board of vessel at Bridgeport, Conn.
in the cabin Of which "A man entered after
a kettle Of burning charcoal had been plac-
ed therein.


A passenger in one of the day boats be-
tween Albany and New York, counted in
the course of the passage, two hundred and
seventy sloops on the North River.


The Mercer "Western Paper" says "the
Printer wants Grain, Pork, Talow, Candles,
Whiskey, Linen, Beeswax, Wool; and any
thing else that he can eat"


The Trustees of the Boston Monument
Association have voted unanimously to have
the Statue of Washington placed in the new
State House.


Passengers in the packet ship Canada, ar
rived at New York, on Monday last--Isaac



Bigge, ]. Fl. Hodges, Thomas Hetherington,
and John lnham.


The blue pendant of Captain Crane, as
commander of the United States Mcditer-
ranean squadron, was hoisted on Friday
week, on board the irigate Java, ~ guns, ly-
ing at Boston, under national salute. She
is expected to sail soon.


154 persons in the city of N. York have
applied for lots in the new town of Guelph,
in Upper Canada.


The Emperor of Russia has given two
thousand roubles, and the Empress dla-
mond ring, to the blind poet J. J. keslov, for
transating Byron's Bride OF Aydos into Rus
sian.


St. Giles Church, in London, has nov
an illuminated dial the clock, by its own
revolution, lights itself as soon as the sun
sets. and extinguishes itself when the sun
rises.

= The Frederick (Md.) Herald of Saturday
states that during heavy gust there on the
9th inst the Methodist meeting house i'll
in that county. was levelled to
the ground. such was the violence of the
wind that some of the heavy timbcrs were
carried considerable distance.
